CREATE_VPG_SELECT_VMS.REVERSE_TITLE: The following VMs are protected in this VPG.
CREATE_VPG_SELECT_VMS.REVERSE_DESC1: You cannot add or remove VMs while configuring reverse protection.
CREATE_VPG_SELECT_VMS.REVERSE_DESC2: If you want to change the VMs in the VPG you can do this after completing the recovery of the VPG.
CREATE_VPG_SELECT_VMS.ZERO_SIZE: One or more vms have a zero disk size
CREATE_VPG_SELECT_VMS.ALL_PROTECTED_TOOLTIP_INFO: Select from all possible VMs: unprotected and already protected.
CREATE_VPG_SELECT_VMS.ALL_PROTECTED_VCD_TOOLTIP_INFO: Select from all possible vApps: unprotected and already protected.
CREATE_VPG_SELECT_VMS.WINDOW_INFO_TITLE: Select VMs to add to the VPG
CREATE_VPG_SELECT_VMS.FILTERED_OUT_TEXT: Some VMs may be filtered out.
CREATE_VPG_SELECT_VMS.SELECT_VCD_VAPP_INFO: Select vApp to add to VPG
CREATE_VPG_SELECT_VMS.HEADER_TOOLTIP_PROTECTED_SIDE: This VM is protected in {{numOfVpgs}} VPGs:
CREATE_VPG_SELECT_VMS.HEADER_TOOLTIP_RECOVERY_SIDE:
This VM is protected in more than one VPG.
Browse to the protected site ZVM for more information.
